text: <@U7SL518D6> commented on <@U7D5W6EVA>’s file <https://HubSpotdev.slack.com/files/U7D5W6EVA/F9ANN55EX/-.html|https://HubSpotdev.slack.com/files/U7D5W6EVA/F9ANN55EX/-.html>: I would create a support ticket then, because those styles shouldn’t load on a live page(that includes staging)

comment.comment: I would create a support ticket then, because those styles shouldn’t load on a live page(that includes staging)

text: I promise I don't get on here to complain. Just trying to get a feel for what's what and where's my best place to go for information. I submitted a question to support regarding the "custom_form_html" param in the HUBL form tag, and after a couple back-and-forths (the rep kept pointing me to the API, but I only wanted to know options available for the one param not anything with the API), I'm told that support isn't the best place to get answers like that, instead I should post on in the community.  So is there 'official' support for dev or is the best place to find the HubSpot developer support reps is in the community forums? thanks
best place to get answers to a question like that is here in the slack or on the community forum. Though my personal experience has been that the slack is where it’s at.

also is there a best bet when it comes to posting to the communities? I consider most of what I do development, but seems that HubSpot wants any HUBL questions to go to the design community and API type questions to go to developers.  Is there any proper protocol here to get the best answers or can I just post everything in developer community and I'll be good to go
The support team is mostly focused on the marketers and their tools. Not the coding aspect of things. They can help with basic design manager things as well as if you see a bug though
ok. thanks Jon. that's good to know
HubSpot refers to front end developers as designers, which yes is a little confusing but that’s what they mean
I was beginning to get that feeling. lol .  thanks for clarifying all this. I posted the HUBL question in the designers community just now, we shall see.

when creating a new blog template, there seems to be no way to preview functionality without actually making it the new blog template. I'm using preview in design manager and told it what blog I want to use to display in preview; however I wanted to test out my tag/ urls, pagination, that kind of stuff. Is there anyway to do so without making it the live blog?
You can try reaching out to your CAM at HubSpot and seeing if they can create a free development portal for you. Then you can transfer the template there and use it to test in a quick spun up blog
<@U2H3TT8F2> is that a thing? them creating a free development portal?
I know as an agency we have one that we reached out for and asked about
Yes, you can also get marketplace focused portals.
both of those would be amazing
currently we have to manually add each marketplace template to a list so our trenddemon doesn't show those pages
I wish when clients signed up they just gave them a free dev portal by default, makes for a great dev -> Prod system
agreed! that would be fantastic

Question on canonical's with HubSpot, i thought that the pages had these set automatically unless you manually override them in advanced option. Am I wrong on this assumption or do you have to add them manually to each page.
I ask because Moz is showing me `missing canonical` errors on some pages

Also, is there a way to update the meta description of things like author pages or topic pages using HubL? Using the Author's profile is not always the best as sometimes authors have a longer(ish) bio and its causing Moz to also show issues on this
You can override any `meta` tag if I recall
Just by setting it before `standard_header_includes`

Has anyone worked with custom cookie-setting solutions on a HS site?

Our client ideally would be using Iubenda to handle this. It comes with a script that handles the blocking of cookies until a user gives consent, by changing the src to data-suppressedsrc attribute and having a special class name. However, I can’t find a way to edit the HS script tag to reflect this method. I tried to use another script to change the #hs-script-loader tag after the page load, but looks like the script still ran, as the leadflow and hs-analytics scripts were added to the document head. Looking at the Networks tab in debugger mode, it looks like the script has loaded by the time my script runs

I know there is an option in Reports Settings to handle the HubSpot cookies internally, but we would like to stick with Iubenda if possible so the consent/script-blocking method can be easily extended to other services as needed, and can be added into smart content to behave differently per region.
Is there any certain tag that needs to be used or just adding a standard meta tag and HS will pick it up and not show the other?
<https://HubSpotdev.slack.com/archives/C22PDRW72/p1514386940000385>
You can see the discussion here for how it is done for dynamic pages
